manufacturing: Let's bake! Chef Alain Ducasse gives you his recipe for the perfect crêpes to go with our hazelnut and peanut spreads. For about 10 crêpes, You will need: Sift the flour and add the sugar. Beat the eggs with the salt. Gently pour them over the flour, stir until the mixture is smooth. Pour in the milk little by little, stirring constantly. Then add the melted butter and oil. Finally grate in the orange and lemon peel. Leave the batter to rest for 2 hours in the fridge. Cook the crêpes in a non-stick pan greased with clarified butter.

manufacturing: DISCOVER THE MANUFACTURING STEPS OF THE VANILLA PEPICOEURS These small milk and dark chocolate hearts have been filled with a praliné so irresistible that one bite is never enough. What if we told you their secret recipe? It all starts with almonds and hazelnuts from Italy (sent by our preferred producers with whom we've been working from the start). They are roasted and covered with cooked sugar to obtain caramelized blocks. These blocks are then ground to make a praliné paste, to which cocoa butter is added for consistency, and Madagascar vanilla beans for subtle, comforting notes. A (love) story with no end in sight!

manufacturing: Let's bake! Chef Alain Ducasse gives you his recipe for the perfect crêpes to go with our hazelnut and peanut spreads. For about 10 crêpes, You will need: Sift the flour and add the sugar. Beat the eggs with the salt. Gently pour them over the flour, stir until the mixture is smooth. Pour in the milk little by little, stirring constantly. Then add the melted butter and oil. Finally grate in the orange and lemon peel. Leave the batter to rest for 2 hours in the fridge. Cook the crêpes in a non-stick pan greased with clarified butter.

title: Cocorico Box 16 Pieces
description: Did you know? In Latin, the word "gallus" means both "Gaul" and "rooster"! Historically, the rooster appeared on Gaulish coins — today, it appears on our treats! In collaboration with the Élysée - Presidency of the Republic brand, Chocolat Alain Ducasse pays tribute to the French symbol and includes the word "Cocorico" inscribed on its pépites. These indulgent treats conceal a dual-praliné heart: hazelnut praline & almond nib praliné for the dark chocolate version, and almond praliné & hazelnut vanilla praliné for the milk chocolate. Proceeds contribute to the funding of the renovation of the Élysée Palace, helping to enhance this historic monument and open it to the French population, 300 years after its construction.
allergens: All our products may contain traces of milk, eggs, gluten, nuts, peanuts, sesame and soya.
